channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Fox News faces critical test in 2nd case over false 2020 election claims
item.description: The allegations in the multibillion-dollar case sound familiar: A voting-tech company accuses Fox News of defamation for false claims it broadcast abo...

item.title: Metroid Prime 4: Beyond is a technical marvel and game design nightmare
item.description: After a decade of development, Metroid Prime 4: Beyond is a beautiful but befuddling game full of misguided design decisions and annoying sidekicks.

item.title: A short social media detox improves mental health, a study shows. Here's how to do it
item.description: Young adults who took just a one-week break from social media showed improvement in depression, anxiety and insomnia symptoms, a new study says. Plus,...

item.title: Pope Leo wraps up his visit to Lebanon with prayers at the site of Beirut's port blast
item.description: Pope Leo XIV ended his first overseas papal trip with prayers at Beirut's devastated port and a Mass attended by 150,000 worshippers in a country desp...

item.title: National Guard attack suspect's crisis. And, U.S. official sheds light on boat strike
item.description: A U.S. official disputes the White House account of the deadly Caribbean boat strike. And, a person familiar with the National Guard shooting suspect ...

item.title: Trump administration considering expanding travel ban to around 30 countries
item.description: The Trump administration is considering expanding its travel ban to around 30 countries in the wake of the shooting of two National Guard soldiers.

item.title: Pope prays at Beirut port blast site on last day of Lebanon visit
item.description: Pope Leo XIV demanded justice for the more than 200 victims of the disaster, at the end of his three-day visit to Lebanon.

item.title: Mass killings in 2025 in the US hit the lowest level since 2006
item.description: Seventeen mass killings have occurred this year in the U.S., the lowest since 2006. Experts say this probably isn’t the start of a bigger trend.

item.title: Pope prays at Beirut port blast site on last day of Lebanon visit
item.description: Pope Leo XIV demanded justice for the more than 200 victims of the disaster, at the end of his three-day visit to Lebanon.

item.title: Note to Self: John Driskell Hopkins reflects on music career and living with ALS
item.description: In the "CBS Mornings" series "Note to Self," John Driskell Hopkins, one of the founding members of country music's Zac Brown Band, reflects on his mus...

item.title: Bulgaria ditches budget plan after tens of thousands join protests
item.description: Demonstrators said the plan - the country's first in euros - attempted to hide widespread government corruption.

item.title: What strategies can you use for emergency debt relief?
item.description: Falling behind on debt requires fast action. Luckily, you have some options for quick relief in this situation.

item.title: A list of mass killings in the United States this year
Zambian-American influencer sentenced to 18 months for hate speech
item.description: Known as "One Boss Lady", Ethel Chisono Edwards has become known for her rants about the president.

item.title: Michael and Susan Dell to give 25 million U.S. kids $250 in "Trump accounts"
item.description: Michael and Susan Dell said they will spend $6.25 billion to fund Invest America accounts for U.S. children.

item.title: Why mortgage rates could drop before the December Fed meeting
item.description: A Fed rate cut looks likely for December 10. Here's why mortgage interest rates may drop before that's announced.

item.title: US Navy admiral ordered second deadly Venezuela boat strike, White House says
item.description: The strikes, authorised by Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth, have raised fresh legality questions - but the White House says laws have been followed.

item.title: A California family was about to cut the cake when gunfire erupted at a toddler’s birthday party
